chatbot_training_qa.question: Does Indus University have a placement department?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Yes. Indus University has an independent Training & Placement Department (T&P Dept.) that acts as a bridge between the university and industry. It has been operational since 2006 and became part of Indus University from 2012 onwards.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What is the highest placement package at Indus University?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The highest placement package is Rs. 30 LPA, offered by LUMMO, Jakarta, Indonesia.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What is the average placement package at Indus University?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The average placement package at Indus University is Rs. 6.8 LPA.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What is the goal of the Training & Placement Department?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The T&P Department aims to provide 100% placements to graduates. It also focuses on sharpening students' organizational and creative skills, building analytical abilities, establishing long-term industry relationships, and preparing students for their dream careers through comprehensive training and industry interaction.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What training programs does Indus University offer for placements?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The T&P Department offers CV writing, communication skills training (written and spoken), employability skill tests, domain-specific technical training, soft-skills and technical workshops, aptitude/technical/psychometric test practice sessions, group discussion sessions, mock interviews by industry experts, and finishing school training before campus drives.

chatbot_training_qa.question: How does Indus University help students get placed?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The T&P Department maintains an updated employer database, liaises with company talent acquisition teams for campus recruitment, conducts both on-campus and off-campus drives, ensures choice-based placement for students, organises expert sessions, guest lectures, industrial visits, internships, and collects employer feedback after each drive.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Which companies recruit from Indus University?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Many well-known companies recruit from Indus University, including Amazon, Capgemini, Oracle, Samsung, Siemens, Tata Motors, Godrej, Adani, BYJU's, Bajaj Allianz, IDFC First Bank, IndusInd Bank, Odoo, Decathlon, JSW Paints, KIA, and many more. The university has a wide and diverse recruiter base across sectors.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Does Indus University support entrepreneurship?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Yes. The T&P Department identifies students keen on entrepreneurship and extends all possible assistance to them. Successful entrepreneurs are also regularly invited to campus to interact with and inspire students.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What is the Industry-Academia Interface at Indus University?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The Industry-Academia Interface includes expert sessions and guest lectures, industrial visits, technical and domain-specific workshops, internships and live projects, campus placements, faculty training in industry, and tie-ups or empanelment with industry and academic institutions.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Does Indus University offer internship opportunities?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Yes. The T&P Department helps students with summer training assignments and facilitates internships and live projects through its industry tie-ups and academia-industry interface program.

chatbot_training_qa.question: How can I contact the Training & Placement Department?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: You can reach the Training & Placement Officer at +91 9879611169.

chatbot_training_qa.question: When was the Training & Placement Department at Indus University established?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The Training & Placement Department was established in 2006, initially associated with the Indus Institute of Technology & Engineering (IITE). It became a part of Indus University from 2012 onwards.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Does Indus University conduct off-campus placements?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Yes. The T&P Department designs and manages both On-Campus and Off-Campus recruitment exercises for students.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Which institutes of Indus University are covered under the placement program?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: All constituent institutes are covered, including IITE (Technology & Engineering), IAS (Architecture), IDS (Design), IIICT (Information & Communication Technology), IIMS (Management Studies), IISHLS (Sciences, Humanities & Liberal Studies), IISS (Special Studies), IIPR (Pharmacy), IIATE (Aviation Technology), and IAGNI (Nanotechnology).

chatbot_training_qa.question: What kind of mock interviews or practice sessions does Indus University provide?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The T&P Department conducts Group Discussion (GD) sessions and Mock Interviews by industry experts, along with practice sessions for aptitude tests, technical tests, and psychometric tests to prepare students thoroughly before campus drives.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Does Indus University conduct industrial visits?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Yes. Industrial visits are conducted regularly as part of the Industry-Academia Interface. Recent visits include trips to Odoo India HQ in Gandhinagar, Heritage Cyber World LLP, and Mundra under Project Udaan organised by IIPR.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What are the key strengths of the Indus University placement department?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Key strengths include an experienced team with a proven track record, strong industry interaction and negotiation skills, the widest network and employer database, adherence to commitments, easy accessibility for both students and employers, and an enviable record of placements and internships.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Has any Indus University student been placed in an international company?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Yes. The highest package of Rs. 30 LPA was offered by LUMMO, an international company based in Jakarta, Indonesia.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What is choice-based placement at Indus University?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Indus University's T&P Department ensures choice-based placement, meaning students are guided and supported to secure placements aligned with their preferred career roles and aspirations rather than being placed arbitrarily.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Does Indus University get feedback from recruiters after campus drives?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Yes. After each campus drive, employer feedback is collected and shared with Department Management, HODs, and Placement Coordinators to continuously improve the quality of students and placement processes.
